title: Cottage pie pots
directions: Boil the sweet potatoes or butternut in a pot of water until tender. Drain and then mash with the butter and milk. Season with salt and pepper and put to one side.
Heat the oil in a large frying pan and fry the onion until soft. Add the garlic, carrot and mince and cook over medium heat for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Add the tomatoes and water, cover and cook on low heat for about 10 minutes. Switch on the ovenâ€™s grill.
Divide the beef mixture between 4 individual pots and spread mash on top of each. Sprinkle with cheese and grill for a few minutes until the tops are brown and crisp.
ingredients: 2 Tbs butter 3 Tbs milk Salt and pepper to taste 1 Tbs oil 1 onion peeled and chopped 1 clove garlic chopped

1 carrot peeled and cut into small chunks 250 g lean beef mince 2-3 medium tomatoes blanched in hot water for 1-2 minutes then peeled and diced 150 ml water 3/4 cup grated Cheddar cheese 450 g sweet potatoes or butternut - peeled and cut into small chunks
